definitions.definition: To divide (a thing) into separate parts .
examples: Separate the articles from the headings.

definitions.definition: To disunite from a group or mass; to disconnect .
To cause (things or people) to be separate.
examples: If the kids get too noisy, separate them for a few minutes.

definitions.definition: To divide itself into separate pieces or substances.
examples: The sauce will separate if you don't keep stirring.

definitions.definition: To set apart; to select from among others, as for a special use or service.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To divide (a thing) into separate parts .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To disunite from a group or mass; to disconnect .
( transitive ) To cause (things or people) to be separate.
( intransitive ) To divide itself into separate pieces or substances.
( obsolete ) To set apart; to select from among others, as for a special use or service.
